title: Deep Autumn Color Palette: What to Wear & What to Avoid

steps.title: Warm hue
steps.content: Warm hue The Deep Autumn color palette has a warm hue, meaning it has more yellow than blue undertones. This makes the palette one of the warmest seasonal palettes with colors with yellow tints. [1] X Research source Hue is the primary color you see, such as red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and violet. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dark value
steps.content: Dark value The Deep Autumn palette has one of the darkest color values among the seasonal palettes. This means the colors within the palette have a lot of depth and aren’t vividly bright or saturated. [3] X Research source Value is how light or dark a color is. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Medium chroma
steps.content: Medium chroma The colors in the Deep Autumn palette have a medium chroma and are neither soft, muted, or bright. This gives the colors a rich warmth that saturated colors can’t convey. [5] X Research source Chroma is how intense, saturated, or bright a color is. [6] X Research source

steps.title: You have dark green, dark hazel, or warm dark brown eyes.
steps.content: You have dark green, dark hazel, or warm dark brown eyes. If you’re a Deep Autumn, you likely have dark, warm eyes. Your pupil is also likely a bit darker than your iris. [7] X Research source

steps.title: You have a neutral-warm skin tone.
steps.content: You have a neutral-warm skin tone. Deep Autumns have neutral skin tones with a warmer, pinker undertone. This means that if you’re a Deep Autumn, you likely look best in gold metals and have a bronze or honey glow to your cheeks. [8] X Research source Determine your skin tone by checking the veins inside your wrist. You’re probably a Deep Autumn if you have green veins.

steps.title: You have medium to dark brown hair.
steps.content: You have medium to dark brown hair. Chances are, if you’re a Deep Autumn, you have golden brown, auburn, or black-brown hair. Your locks likely have a honey hue to them that develops red or gold highlights in the sun. [9] X Research source Still not sure if you’re a Deep Autumn? Ask a stylist, professional color analyst, or fashion expert for help! They can give you a personalized assessment and help you determine your seasonal color palette .

steps.title: Wear warm, neutral, and deep shades.
steps.content: Wear warm, neutral, and deep shades. Deep Autumns look best in colors that bring out their golden glow. Think about the fall season. The colors you decorate your house with in November are perfect! Yellow-based shades with rich, earthy undertones are will pull out your natural features and make you shine. [10] X Research source For instance, try wearing: Off-white Dark vanilla Dark blue Cappuccino Dark brown Charcoal Dark teal Dusty rose Burnt orange Dusty peach Plum Eggplant [11] X Research source Cranberry Forest green

steps.title: Avoid light and cool colors.
steps.content: Avoid light and cool colors. If you’re a Deep Autumn, pale and cool-toned colors can wash out your natural depth and warmth. Whites, pastels, and frosty tones will look odd against your honey glow. So, if you want to look your absolute best, avoid these colors: [12] X Research source Pure white Pastel pink Mauve Blue gray Silver Bright red Bright orange

steps.title: Pick high-contrast colors.
steps.content: Pick high-contrast colors. Deep Autumns have a naturally high contrast between their skin tone and other features. So, if you’re a Deep Autumn, adhere to your organic depth by pairing light and dark colors together. The more contrast your outfit has, the better you’ll look. Pair colors from opposite sides of the color wheel for a complementary look, like mustard yellow and navy blue. Mix a dark neutral with a lighter accent for a simple contrast, such as dark brown and apricot. Keep it simple with a light neutral and a dark accent, like beige and emerald green.

steps.title: Choose patterns with contrasting colors.
steps.content: Choose patterns with contrasting colors. When it comes to patterns and prints, those with tones from a Deep Autumn’s color palette always look best. Opt for a print with high contrast, featuring a light and dark color, to make your natural depth pop amongst the details. [13] X Research source In other words, choose prints with dark backgrounds and colorful images with light and dark accents. Avoid natural floral patterns (such as paisley and oriental designs), as these can be too light and dainty against your darker features. Stick with patterns that have larger elements that are loosely arranged or have a broad space between them.

steps.title: Wear brass, gold, bronze, and pewter accessories.
steps.content: Wear brass, gold, bronze, and pewter accessories. With a neutral-warm skin tone, accessories with a yellow tone look best on a Deep Autumn because it highlights their natural warm glow. So, if you’re a Deep Autumn, avoid metals with cool undertones (like silver or white gold) as these can overpower your undertones and wash you out. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Accentuate your features with warm-toned makeup.
steps.content: Accentuate your features with warm-toned makeup. If you’re a Deep Autumn, you don’t have any blue undertones. This means you look best in warm shades that bring out your pink or honey glow. So, avoid dark and bright colors that don’t overpower your natural qualities. Opt for a salmon pink or deep red lipstick . Try a cream , apricot , olive , gold , or bronze eyeshadow . Choose a spiced cinnamon and terracotta blush . Stay away from thick black eyeliner and bright red lipstick.

steps.title: Choose a dark and rich hair color.
steps.content: Choose a dark and rich hair color. If you want to color your hair as a Deep Autumn, stick with your natural color pairings and go with a dark, warm shade. This will enhance your overall appearance and make your skin and eyes pop. [15] X Research source Warm and dark browns, caramel, and dark auburn are the most flattering on Deep Autumns. Bright colors, ashy blondes, and blue blacks are the worst hair colors for a Deep Autumn.

steps.title: Deep Autumn is warm, while Dark Winter is cool.
steps.content: Deep Autumn is warm, while Dark Winter is cool. While these 2 color palettes look very similar, they’re not the same. Dark or Deep Winters have high-contrast features and cool undertones. [16] X Research source Deep Autumns, on the other hand, have a rich coloring with golden or honey undertones. Think of it like this: Deep Autumn is fire, while Dark Winter is ice.

These celebrities have a Deep or Dark Autumn color palette. They have a warm honey glow to them and contrasting features. Chances are, if you look like one of these celebrities, you’re probably a Deep Autumn. [17] X Research source Angela Bassett Aubrey Plaza Brenda Song Chrissy Teigen Daniel Kaluuya David Tennant Denzel Washington Emma Watson Garcelle Beauvais Hailee Steinfeld Halle Berry Hugh Jackman Jason Momoa Jeannie Mai Julia Roberts Kate Mara Maya Rudolph Meghan Markle Millie Bobby Brown Ming-Na Wen Minka Kelly Natalie Portman Oprah Winfrey Rashida Jones Rebecca Hall Ryan Reynolds Serena Williams Sofia Vergara Zendaya
